text:
I’ve experimented quite a bit with deep writing (before it was called that) as well, and the loss of coherence over longer passages of text got me away from stories and screenplays.

I ended up training a network with the complete works of several classic German poets and the verses it generated were actually quite nice.

My next step had been to use CNNs to get a layer of structure over the letters, but alas, a new job doesn’t leave me enough time to get anywhere with it. I have heard however that others have started using convolutional networks for NLP, but didn’t have the time to research it.

Maybe, some day, I’ll have the time, but until then, I think the best way to leverage LSTMs capabilities for writing is generating text that has short term struck structure like poetry or speeches.
